title: Why Netflix is breaking the uneasy truce between cinema and TV
text:
Movies, like the Mafia, function on respect. When Netflix entered into negotiations with American cinema chains about screening Martin Scorsese’s latest gangster epic, The Irishman, they probably hoped that Netflix would show them the deference due to an ageing don, accepting their territorial claims and their time-tested methods.

Instead, those negotiations collapsed, and when Scorsese’s $159m (£129m) creation comes out next month it will play in a select few cinemas only – thanks, it seems, to a failure of respect.
